1: %% @doc Property-based tests for router_policy_store
    2: %% Uses PropEr for randomized sequence of operations to detect race conditions
    3: -module(router_policy_store_prop_SUITE).
    4: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    5: 
    6: %% Check if PropEr is available
    7: -ifdef(TEST).
    8: -define(HAVE_PROPER, code:which(proper) =/= non_existing).
    9: -else.
   10: -define(HAVE_PROPER, false).
   11: -endif.
   12: 
   13: -ifdef(HAVE_PROPER).
   14: -include_lib("proper/include/proper.hrl").
   15: -endif.
   16: 
   17: -compile(export_all).
   18: 
   19: -export([all/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   20: 
   21: -include("beamline_router.hrl").
   22: 
   23: all() ->
   24:     [
   25:         prop_concurrent_operations,
   26:         prop_upsert_delete_consistency,
   27:         prop_list_policies_ordering,
   28:         prop_index_consistency
   29:     ].
   30: 
   31: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   32:     %% Start application with ephemeral port
   33:     _ = application:load(beamline_router),
   34:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_port, 0),
   35:     %% Disable heir/transfer logic for faster test execution
   36:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, disable_heir, true),
   37:     case application:ensure_all_started(beamline_router) of
   38:         {ok, _} ->
   39:             timer:sleep(200),
   40:             {ok, Config};
   41:         Error ->
   42:             ct:fail("Failed to start beamline_router: ~p", [Error])
   43:     end.
   44: 
   45: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   46:     application:stop(beamline_router),
   47:     Config.
   48: 
   49: %% Property: Concurrent operations maintain consistency
   50: prop_concurrent_operations(_Config) ->
   51:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
   52:         false ->
   53:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
   54:         true ->
   55:             Prop = ?FORALL(
   56:                 Operations,
   57:                 list(operation()),
   58:                 begin
   59:                     TenantId = <<"prop_tenant">>,
   60:                     %% Execute operations sequentially (gen_server serializes)
   61:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Operations],
   62:                     
   63:                     %% Verify final state is consistent
   64:                     {ok, FinalPolicies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
   65:                     
   66:                     %% Check: all policies in list should be valid
   67:                     AllValid = lists:all(fun(P) ->
   68:                         is_record(P, policy) andalso
   69:                         P#policy.tenant_id =:= TenantId
   70:                     end, FinalPolicies),
   71:                     
   72:                     %% Check: no duplicate policy_ids
   73:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- FinalPolicies],
   74:                     NoDuplicates = length(PolicyIds) =:= length(lists:usort(PolicyIds)),
   75:                     
   76:                     AllValid andalso NoDuplicates
   77:                 end
   78:             ),
   79:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}, {max_shrink, 50}]) of
   80:                 true -> ok;
   81:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
   82:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
   83:             end
   84:     end.
   85: 
   86: %% Property: Upsert and delete maintain consistency
   87: prop_upsert_delete_consistency(_Config) ->
   88:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
   89:         false ->
   90:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
   91:         true ->
   92:             Prop = ?FORALL(
   93:                 {Upserts, Deletes},
   94:                 {list(upsert_operation()), list(delete_operation())},
   95:                 begin
   96:                     TenantId = <<"prop_consistency_tenant">>,
   97:                     
   98:                     %% Execute all upserts
   99:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Upserts],
  100:                     
  101:                     %% Execute all deletes
  102:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Deletes],
  103:                     
  104:                     %% Verify: deleted policies should not be in list
  105:                     {ok, Policies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  106:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- Policies],
  107:                     
  108:                     %% Get deleted policy IDs
  109:                     DeletedIds = [PolicyId || {delete, PolicyId} <- Deletes],
  110:                     
  111:                     %% Check: no deleted policy should be in final list
  112:                     lists:all(fun(DeletedId) ->
  113:                         not lists:member(DeletedId, PolicyIds)
  114:                     end, DeletedIds)
  115:                 end
  116:             ),
  117:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}, {max_shrink, 50}]) of
  118:                 true -> ok;
  119:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  120:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
  121:             end
  122:     end.
  123: 
  124: %% Property: list_policies always returns sorted results
  125: prop_list_policies_ordering(_Config) ->
  126:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
  127:         false ->
  128:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
  129:         true ->
  130:             Prop = ?FORALL(
  131:                 Policies,
  132:                 list(policy()),
  133:                 begin
  134:                     TenantId = <<"prop_ordering_tenant">>,
  135:                     
  136:                     %% Clear existing policies
  137:                     {ok, Existing} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  138:                     [router_policy_store:delete_policy(TenantId, P#policy.policy_id) || P <- Existing],
  139:                     
  140:                     %% Insert all policies
  141:                     [router_policy_store:upsert_policy(TenantId, P) || P <- Policies],
  142:                     
  143:                     %% Get list
  144:                     {ok, Listed} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  145:                     
  146:                     %% Check: results are sorted by policy_id (lexicographic binary order)
  147:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- Listed],
  148:                     Sorted = lists:sort(fun(Id1, Id2) ->
  149:                         binary:compare(Id1, Id2) =:= less
  150:                     end, PolicyIds),
  151:                     
  152:                     PolicyIds =:= Sorted
  153:                 end
  154:             ),
  155:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}, {max_shrink, 50}]) of
  156:                 true -> ok;
  157:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  158:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
  159:             end
  160:     end.
  161: 
  162: %% Property: Secondary index maintains consistency with main table
  163: prop_index_consistency(_Config) ->
  164:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
  165:         false ->
  166:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
  167:         true ->
  168:             Prop = ?FORALL(
  169:                 Operations,
  170:                 list(operation()),
  171:                 begin
  172:                     TenantId = <<"prop_index_tenant">>,
  173:                     
  174:                     %% Execute operations
  175:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Operations],
  176:                     
  177:                     %% Get policies via list_policies (uses index)
  178:                     {ok, IndexedPolicies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  179:                     IndexedIds = lists:sort([P#policy.policy_id || P <- IndexedPolicies]),
  180:                     
  181:                     %% Get policies via direct lookup (bypasses index)
  182:                     AllKeys = ets:match(policy_store, {{TenantId, '$1'}, '_'}),
  183:                     DirectIds = lists:sort([Id || [Id] <- AllKeys]),
  184:                     
  185:                     %% Check: index and direct lookup should match
  186:                     IndexConsistent = IndexedIds =:= DirectIds,
  187:                     
  188:                     %% Check: for each {TenantId, PolicyId} in main table, there's exactly one entry in index
  189:                     IndexTable = policy_store_index,
  190:                     AllIndexEntries = ets:match_object(IndexTable, {TenantId, '_'}),
  191:                     IndexPolicyIds = lists:sort([PolicyId || {_TenantId, PolicyId} <- AllIndexEntries]),
  192:                     
  193:                     %% Check: all policies in main table have corresponding index entries
  194:                     AllMainPolicies = ets:match_object(policy_store, {{TenantId, '_'}, '_'}),
  195:                     MainPolicyIds = lists:sort([PolicyId || {{_TenantId, PolicyId}, _Policy} <- AllMainPolicies]),
  196:                     
  197:                     IndexComplete = MainPolicyIds =:= IndexPolicyIds,
  198:                     
  199:                     %% Check: bag index invariants
  200:                     %% 1. Each {TenantId, PolicyId} pair appears exactly once in index
  201:                     %% Bag allows multiple entries per key, but each {tenant_id, policy_id} pair should be unique
  202:                     IndexPairs = [{T, P} || {T, P} <- AllIndexEntries],
  203:                     UniquePairs = lists:usort(IndexPairs),
  204:                     NoDuplicates = length(IndexPairs) =:= length(UniquePairs),
  205:                     
  206:                     %% 2. For each policy in main table, there's exactly one index entry
  207:                     OneToOne = length(MainPolicyIds) =:= length(IndexPolicyIds),
  208:                     
  209:                     %% 3. Bag index deletion uses delete_object (not delete)
  210:                     %% This ensures that only specific {tenant_id, policy_id} pairs are removed,
  211:                     %% not all entries for a tenant_id
  212:                     %% Verification: index should only contain pairs that exist in main table
  213:                     IndexPairsSet = sets:from_list(IndexPairs),
  214:                     MainPairsSet = sets:from_list([{TenantId, PolicyId} || {{_T, PolicyId}, _} <- AllMainPolicies]),
  215:                     IndexMatchesMain = sets:is_equal(IndexPairsSet, MainPairsSet),
  216:                     
  217:                     %% All checks must pass
  218:                     IndexConsistent andalso IndexComplete andalso NoDuplicates andalso OneToOne andalso IndexMatchesMain
  219:                 end
  220:             ),
  221:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}, {max_shrink, 50}]) of
  222:                 true -> ok;
  223:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  224:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
  225:             end
  226:     end.
  227: 
  228: %% Generators
  229: 
  230: operation() ->
  231:     oneof([
  232:         upsert_operation(),
  233:         delete_operation()
  234:     ]).
  235: 
  236: upsert_operation() ->
  237:     ?LET(
  238:         {PolicyId, Weights},
  239:         {policy_id(), weights()},
  240:         {upsert, #policy{
  241:             tenant_id = <<"prop_tenant">>,
  242:             policy_id = PolicyId,
  243:             weights = Weights,
  244:             version = <<"1.0">>,
  245:             defaults = #{},
  246:             escalate_on = [],
  247:             fallback = undefined,
  248:             sticky = undefined,
  249:             metadata = #{}
  250:         }}
  251:     ).
  252: 
  253: delete_operation() ->
  254:     ?LET(
  255:         PolicyId,
  256:         policy_id(),
  257:         {delete, PolicyId}
  258:     ).
  259: 
  260: policy() ->
  261:     ?LET(
  262:         {PolicyId, Weights},
  263:         {policy_id(), weights()},
  264:         #policy{
  265:             tenant_id = <<"prop_tenant">>,
  266:             policy_id = PolicyId,
  267:             weights = Weights,
  268:             version = <<"1.0">>,
  269:             defaults = #{},
  270:             escalate_on = [],
  271:             fallback = undefined,
  272:             sticky = undefined,
  273:             metadata = #{}
  274:         }
  275:     ).
  276: 
  277: policy_id() ->
  278:     ?LET(
  279:         N,
  280:         integer(1, 1000),
  281:         list_to_binary("policy_" ++ integer_to_list(N))
  282:     ).
  283: 
  284: weights() ->
  285:     ?LET(
  286:         Providers,
  287:         list({provider_id(), weight()}),
  288:         maps:from_list(Providers)
  289:     ).
  290: 
  291: provider_id() ->
  292:     oneof([<<"openai">>, <<"anthropic">>, <<"cohere">>]).
  293: 
  294: weight() ->
  295:     ?LET(
  296:         W,
  297:         real(),
  298:         max(0.0, min(1.0, abs(W)))
  299:     ).
  300: 
  301: %% Helpers
  302: 
  303: execute_operation(TenantId, {upsert, Policy}) ->
  304:     router_policy_store:upsert_policy(TenantId, Policy);
  305: execute_operation(TenantId, {delete, PolicyId}) ->
  306:     router_policy_store:delete_policy(TenantId, PolicyId).
  307:
